Activity: Log in, brew a strong cup of coffee, and catch up on industry news related to EHR systems and influenza data collection. Scan emails for urgent requests or updates from last week. Maybe browse a few articles on the latest tech trends while the coffee kicks in.
Review project documentation related to the influenza data collection initiative, specifically focusing on Subtask 7 to refresh my understanding of the required system modifications.

Draft an email to the EHR vendor @PEOPLE, outlining the need for a meeting to discuss system modifications to support influenza data collection. Specify key areas for discussion, including new data fields, workflow customization, and new functionalities as per Subtask 7. Request their availability for a meeting later this week. Topic: EHR System Modifications for Influenza Data Collection

Prepare a preliminary list of questions for the EHR vendor regarding system modification options. Include questions about data field creation, workflow customization feasibility, and potential integration challenges. Start a cost-benefit analysis framework.
Lunch break. Check out a new sandwich shop near the hospital.
Continue preparing the question list. Refine my understanding of the impact on existing workflows by consulting with @clinlead-1 via email. Topic: Potential Workflow Impacts of EHR Modifications.
Research best practices for influenza data collection within EHR systems. Look for case studies or white papers on successful implementations.

Begin compiling a document outlining the hospital's specific requirements for influenza data collection. This will serve as a reference point for the discussion with the EHR vendor. Include example data points and desired reporting capabilities.
Review the day's progress and prioritize tasks for tomorrow. Respond to any urgent emails that came in during the afternoon. Then start planning for dinner.
